intro: Chabertia hungarica, commonly known as the Hungarian chabertia, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Chabertia hungarica thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks.
